meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - or rather, Penny the Hippo Reviewer Extraordinaire!

Okay, let's dive into this delightful game, Songs of Conquest! As a seasoned (get it?) grog video game reviewer, I'm excited to share my thoughts on this charming turn-based tactics anthology.

First off, I gotta give props to Lavapotion for creating a game that's got heart, just like those Eurogamer folks said. Yeah, there might be some punishing battles and occasional unevenness, but hey, it's all part of the charm, right?

Now, let's talk about the gameplay. Oh boy, where do I even start? It's like The Games Machine said - this game has a perfect balance of factions (I mean, who doesn't love a good ol' Heroes of Might and Magic vibe?) and loads of content! I'm talking full support for community-made stuff, folks! You know what that means? ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES!

And don't even get me started on the single-player campaign. PC Games was spot-on when they said it shines with playful depth and great scope. I mean, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned RPG experience?

Now, let's address those critics who think this game is just a copy-and-paste job (cough, IGN Italia, cough). Listen, I get it - nostalgia is powerful, and if you're gonna do it, do it right! Lavapotion has masterfully added their own personal touches to that solid turn-based gameplay, and the result is... well, let me just say it's a game-changer.

All in all, Songs of Conquest is the real deal. It's got heart, it's got humor (okay, maybe not that last one), and it's got more content than you can shake a stick at!

So, what are you waiting for? Go grab this game and get ready to conquer... er, I mean, sing along with me!
